Message.MsgText: A to call commit() or rollback() on a Session object failed because the session was not configured as a transacted session.

Explanation.p: The commit() or rollback() methods can only be called on a Session object that is configured as a transacted session.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the session is correctly configured for transactions.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a shared or durable consumer failed because the subscription name is not a valid UTF-16 string.

Explanation.p: The String object that specifies a subscription name must be a valid UTF-16 string.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the characters in the durable or shared subscription name form a valid UTF-16 string.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a temporary topic or temporary queue failed due to an exception.

Explanation.p: An error caused the creation of a temporary destination to fail.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a message consumer failed because it specified a temporary topic or a temporary queue that is associated with a different connection.

Explanation.p: A temporary destination can be used only within the connection that created it.

OperatorResponse.p: If a temporary topic or temporary queue is required for this message consumer, ensure that it is created on a session that is in the same connection as the consumer.

Message.MsgText: A method called to delete a temporary topic or a temporary queue failed because the temporary destination has active message consumers.

Explanation.p: A temporary destination can be deleted only when it does not have message consumers.

OperatorResponse.p: Close the associated message consumers before attempting to delete the temporary topic or temporary queue.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a durable or shared subscription failed because it specified a temporary topic.

Explanation.p: A durable or shared subscription can be created only for a standard (non-temporary) topic.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only standard (non-temporary) topics for durable and shared subscriptions.

Message.MsgText: An operation that requires the destination name to be set failed because the destination name is not set.

Explanation.p: The destination name must be set before calling getTopicName(), getQueueName(), createBrowser(), createConsumer(), createDurableSubscriber(), send(), or publish(), and before calling createProducer() if specifying a non-null destination.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the destination name is set before calling getTopicName(),getQueueName(), createBrowser(), createConsumer(), createDurableSubscriber(), send(), or publish(), and before calling createProducer() if specifying a non-null destination.

Message.MsgText: A call to a Connection object method failed because the connection is closed.

Explanation.p: A Connection object method call can be made only when the connection is active.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the connection is active before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: A call to a Session object method failed because the session is closed.

Explanation.p: A Session object method call can be made only when the session is active.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the session is active before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: A call to a MessageConsumer object method failed because the consumer is closed.

Explanation.p: A MessageConsumer object method call can be made only when the consumer is active.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the consumer is active before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: A call to a MessageProducer object method failed because the producer is closed.

Explanation.p: A MessageProducer object method call can be made only when the producer is active.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the producer is active before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: An operation that requires a non-null destination failed because the destination object is null.

Explanation.p: A non-null destination object is required in calls to createBrowser(), createConsumer(), createDurableSubscriber(), send(), or publish().

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the destination object exists before calling createBrowser(), createConsumer(), createDurableSubscriber(), send(), or publish().

Message.MsgText: An operation that requires an ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} destination failed because a non-${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} destination ({0}) was used.

Explanation.p: An ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} destination is required when creating consumers, queue browsers, and producers with an ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} session object, and when sending or publishing messages with an ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} producer.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} destination objects to create consumers, queue browsers, and producers with an ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} session object, and to send or publish messages with ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} producers.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a durable subscription failed because the connection has a generated client ID.

Explanation.p: A non-shared durable subscriber can be created only on an ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} connection with a client ID that is set in the connection factory administered object, or by calling setClientID() on the Connection object.

OperatorResponse.p: When using non-shared durable subscriptions, ensure that the client ID value for a connection was set in the connection factory administered object, or by calling setClientID() on the Connection object.

Message.MsgText: A call to a queue browser object method failed because the queue browser is closed.

Explanation.p: A queue browser object method call can be made only when the queue browser is active.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the queue browser is active before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: An operation to store a TemporaryTopic or a TemoraryQueue in a JNDI repository failed because temporary destinations are runtime objects only.

Explanation.p: You can store only non-temporary Topic and Queue destinations in JNDI.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that you store destination objects of type Topic or Queue only in JNDI.

Message.MsgText: A queue method ({0}) failed because it was called on a TopicSession object.

Explanation.p: Only methods associated with the TopicSession interface can be called on TopicSession objects.

OperatorResponse.p: Call only those methods that are permitted on a TopicSession object.

Message.MsgText: A topic method ({0}) failed because it was called on a QueueSession object.

Explanation.p: Only methods associated with the QueueSession interface can be called on QueueSession objects.

OperatorResponse.p: Call only those methods that are permitted on a QueueSession object.

Message.MsgText: A call to recover() failed because the Session object is configured as a transacted session.

Explanation.p: The recover() method is permitted only on non-transacted sessions.

OperatorResponse.p: Use rollback() on transacted sessions.

Message.MsgText: The client failed when sending a message to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. This can occur if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} closes the connection (for example, during shut down), or if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is stopped. It can also occur due to network problems.

Explanation.p: An exception occurred when the client was sending a message to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: A request to create a non-shared durable message consumer failed because an active non-shared durable consumer already exists: Name={0} ClientID={1}.

Explanation.p: Only one active consumer at a time is permitted for a non-shared durable subscription. You can modify the properties of an existing non-shared durable subscription only when there are no active consumers. You can create an additional durable message consumer for this ClientID by using a different subscription name.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the subscription names are unique and that a non-shared durable subscription has no active consumers before you modify it.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to connect to the specified ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} hosts. Servers: {0} Port={1} Protocol={2}. To see failure information for all failed connection attempts, enable client trace at level 2 or above.

Explanation.p: Client requests to connect to one or more ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} hosts failed. The caused by information is for the first connection failure.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is running on at least one of the hosts and that the host name and port match those that are used by ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. To check the error information for each of the individual connection failures, enable trace at level 2 or above.

Message.MsgText: The client failed unexpectedly.

Explanation.p: A connection object was forced to close due to an error that was caused by a non-JMSException.

OperatorResponse.p: You must configure an error listener in order to examine the exception content for this case.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to process a message received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the message type ({0}) is unknown.

Explanation.p: A message with an unknown type was received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. This might indicate data corruption occurred when the message was transmitted from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} to the client.

OperatorResponse.p: If the problem persists, contact IBM Support for assistance.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to parse a message received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the message is not valid.

Explanation.p: A message that could not be properly parsed was received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. This might indicate data corruption occurred when the message was transmitted from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} to the client.

OperatorResponse.p: If the problem persists, contact IBM Support for assistance.

Message.MsgText: A client request to create a temporary queue failed with ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} return code = {0}.

Explanation.p: ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} reported a failure when processing a client request to create a temporary queue.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} administrator and provide the reported return code.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to connect to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} at the specified host and port ({0}:{1}) because the client does not have the required Java privilege.

Explanation.p: The Java security policy prevented the client from connecting to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

OperatorResponse.p: To acquire the required permission, you must contact your system administrator to request modification of the Java security policy that is used by the client.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to connect to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because either the specified host is null or the specified port number is not in the range 0 to 65535: Host={0} Port={1}.

Explanation.p: The client requires a non-null string value specified for the Server property and an integer value in the range 0 to 65535 to make a connection request.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the Server property for the connection object is set and that the Port property is set to a value in the range 0 to 65535.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to connect to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the host {0} could not be resolved.

Explanation.p: The host name or IP address specified for the Server property in the connection factory could not be resolved.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the correct value is specified for the connection factory Server property. If the Server property value is correct, contact your network administrator.

Message.MsgText: A call to setClientID() on a Connection object failed because the client ID was previously set.

Explanation.p: The client ID can only be set once on a connection. If the client ID is set in the connection factory properties, setClientID() cannot be called. When used, setClientID() can be called only once.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the client ID is not set before calling setClientID() and that setClientID() is not called more than one time.

Message.MsgText: A call to setClientID() on a Connection object failed because a null input string was provided for the clientID value.

Explanation.p: The setClientID() method requires a non-null input string for the clientID value.

OperatorResponse.p: Always specify a non-null string for clientID.

Message.MsgText: The string that is specified as the clientID for a connection is not a valid UTF-16 string.

Explanation.p: The clientID for a connection must be a valid UTF-16 string.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the characters in the clientID form a valid UTF-16 string.

Message.MsgText: A call writeUTF() on a BytesMessage failed because the input string is too long. The maximum length is 65535 bytes.

Explanation.p: The input string for a call to writeUTF() on a BytesMessage must not exceed 65535 bytes when converted to UTF-8.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the input string does not exceed 65535 bytes when converted to UTF-8.

Message.MsgText: A method call to set an object on a message failed because the input object type ({0}) is not supported. The object types that are supported are Boolean, Byte, byte[], Character, Double, Float, Integer, Long, Short, and String.

Explanation.p: The input object for calls to setObjectProperty(), writeObject(), or setObject() must be one of the following types: Boolean, Byte, byte[], Character, Double, Float, Integer, Long, Short, String.

OperatorResponse.p: When calling setObjectProperty() on Message objects, or when calling writeObject() in a BytesMessage or setObject() on a MapMessage, ensure that the object type is one of the following types: Boolean, Byte, byte[], Character, Double, Float, Integer, Long, Short, String

Message.MsgText: A call to the setDeliveryMode() method on a producer failed because the input value is not a valid delivery mode. Valid delivery modes are DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT and DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

Explanation.p: The input value for calls to the setDeliveryMode() method must be DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT or DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only valid delivery mode values: DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT and DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

Message.MsgText: A call to the setPriority() method on a message object or on a MessageProducer object failed because the input value is not a valid priority ({0}). Valid priority values are integers in the range 0 to 9.

Explanation.p: The setPriority() method was called on a Message object or on a MessageProducer object with a value that is not in the range of 0 to 9.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only valid priority values in the range 0 to 9.

Message.MsgText: A method called to create a message property failed because the property name value ({0}) is not valid.

Explanation.p: A message property name value must be a valid Java identifier.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that when Character.isJavaIdentifierStart() is called on the first character of the name, it returns true. Ensure that when Character.isJavaIdentifierPart() is called on each of the remaining characters in the name, it returns true for each character.

Message.MsgText: A write operation failed on a message object body or on a message object property because the message was in read only state.

Explanation.p: A write operation on a message object body or on message object properties is permitted only when the message body or properties are writable.

OperatorResponse.p: The clearBody() method clears the message body and makes the message writable. The clearProperties() method clears message properties and makes them writable.

Message.MsgText: A request failed because the string ({0}) contains characters that do not form a valid UTF-16 string. This is usually caused by mismatched surrogate characters.

Explanation.p: A clientID, destination name, message selector, subscription name, or message body string must be a valid UTF-16 string.

OperatorResponse.p: Correct the string value reported in the error message.

Message.MsgText: The property name ({0}) is not a valid UTF-16 string.

Explanation.p: A property name must be a valid UTF-16 string.

OperatorResponse.p: Correct the property name string reported in the error message.

Message.MsgText: A call to the setObject() method on an ObjectMessage failed due to an exception that occurred during serialization.

Explanation.p: An unexpected error occurred during serialization in a call to setObject() on an ObjectMessage.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: A call to send() or publish() on a message producer failed because the message is null. The message cannot be null.

Explanation.p: A non-null message must be specified in a call to send() or publish().

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the message object exists before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: A call to writeBytes() or writeUTF() on a BytesMessage failed due to an exception.

Explanation.p: An unexpected error occurred in a call to writeBytes() or writeUTF() on a BytesMessage.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: A request failed due to an InterruptedException when waiting for a response from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

Explanation.p: An unexpected failure occurred while waiting for a response from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for the InterruptedException.

Message.MsgText: The client failed because a socket connection read error ({0}) occurred when receiving data from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}. This can occur if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} closes the connection (for example, during shut down), or if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is stopped. It can also occur due to network problems.

Explanation.p: A socket connection read error occurred because of a communication failure between the JMS client and ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

OperatorResponse.p: If ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is stopped, normal behavior resumes after it is restarted. If ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is not stopped, contact your network administrator for assistance.

Message.MsgText: The client failed because it received data from the server that was not the correct length ({0}). This can happen if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} closes the connection (for example, during shut down), or if ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is down. It can also occur due to network problems.

Explanation.p: A read failure occurred because the JMS client received data that was not the correct length.

OperatorResponse.p: If ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is stopped, normal behavior resumes after it is restarted. If ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} is not stopped, contact your network administrator for assistance.

Message.MsgText: The JMS client failed to establish a connection to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} at host {0} because it does not have the required authorization in the Java security policy.

Explanation.p: The JMS client requires appropriate JVM security policy to establish connections to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: A call to send() or publish() on a MessageProducer object failed because the destination is not set. The destination must be set.

Explanation.p: The destination must be set on the MessageProducer, TopicPublisher or QueueSender object or it must be specified in the call to send() or publish().

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the destination is set in the producer or in the call to send() or publish().

Message.MsgText: A call to send() or publish() on a MessageProducer object failed because it specified a destination, but the destination was previously set on the producer.

Explanation.p: The destination must be set only once. If the destination is set on the MessageProducer, TopicPublisher or QueueSender object, it must not be set in calls to send() or publish() for that producer.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the destination is set either in the producer or in the call to send() or publish() but not in both places.

Message.MsgText: A call to nextElement() on a QueueBrowser's Enumeration object failed because the browser is closed.

Explanation.p: Elements in a QueueBrowser's Enumeration object can be accessed only when the browser is open.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that calls to nextElement() are made only when QueueBrowser objects are still open.

Message.MsgText: A call to nextElement() on a QueueBrowser's Enumeration object failed because there are no more elements to be browsed.

Explanation.p: When there are no remaining elements in a QueueBrowser's Enumeration object, a call to nextElement() causes NoSuchElementException.

OperatorResponse.p: None. NoSuchElementException indicates that the end of the data was reached. However, to avoid the exception, you can call hasMoreElements() before calling nextElement().

Message.MsgText: A call to method {0} failed because the method is not supported. Use {1}.

Explanation.p: The failed method listed in the error message is not supported by the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} JMS client.

OperatorResponse.p: Use the supported method indicated in the error message.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a message property failed because the specified property ({0}) does not exist on the message.

Explanation.p: The getByteProperty(), getDoubleProperty(), getFloatProperty(), getIntProperty(), getLongProperty(), and getShortProperty() method calls must throw either a NullPointerException or a NumberFormatException if the specified property does not exist.

OperatorResponse.p: Either implement exception handling for method calls to retrieve a message property, or ensure that the specified property exists and is spelled correctly in the call to retrieve it.

Message.MsgText: A method call to set a message property failed because the specified property name is null or is an empty string.

Explanation.p: The name for a message property must be a non-null string with a length of at least one character in calls to setBooleanProperty(), setByteProperty(), setDoubleProperty(), setFloatProperty(), setIntProperty(), setLongProperty(), setObjectProperty(), setShortProperty(), and setByteProperty().

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the property name is a string with at least one character.

Message.MsgText: A call to send() or publish() failed because the delivery mode is not valid. Valid delivery modes are DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT and DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

Explanation.p: The delivery mode value in calls to send() or publish() must be DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT or DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only valid delivery mode values: DeliveryMode.NON_PERSISTENT and DeliveryMode.PERSISTENT.

Message.MsgText: A failure occurred when reading data received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the end of the message content was reached. This typically means that all of the data was read and no further reading is required.

Explanation.p: An exception occurs when the client attempts to read past the end of message content. When unexpected, this error can indicate data corruption.

OperatorResponse.p: None if a normal end of message was reached when processing a JMS message object. For cases where data corruption might have occurred, examine to the stack trace to determine where the failure occurred.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Boolean from a Message object failed because the value is not Boolean and cannot be successfully converted to Boolean.

Explanation.p: The getBoolean(), readBoolean(), and getBooleanProperty() methods can read only Boolean values or values that can be converted to Boolean.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Byte from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Byte and cannot be successfully converted to Byte.

Explanation.p: The getByte(), readByte(), and getByteProperty() methods can read only Byte values or values that can be converted to Byte.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Double from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Double and cannot be successfully converted to Double.

Explanation.p: The getDouble(), readDouble(), and getDoubleProperty() methods can read only Double values or values that can be converted to Double.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve an Integer from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Integer and cannot be successfully converted to Integer.

Explanation.p: The getInt(), to readInt(), and getIntProperty() methods can read only Integer values or values that can be converted to Integer.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Float from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Float and cannot be successfully converted to Float.

Explanation.p: The getFloat(), readFloat(), and getFloatProperty() methods can read only Float values or values that can be converted to Float.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Long from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Long and cannot be successfully converted to Long.

Explanation.p: The getLong(), readLong(), and getLongProperty() methods can read only Long values or values that can be converted to Long.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve a Short from a Message object failed because the value is not of type Short and cannot be successfully converted to Short.

Explanation.p: The getShort(), readShort(), and getShortProperty() methods can read only Short values or values that can be converted to Short.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A call to getString() or readString() on a Message object failed because the value is not of type String and cannot be successfully converted to String.

Explanation.p: The getString()and readString() methods can read only String values or values that can be converted to String.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A call to getChar() or readChar() on a Message object failed because the value is not of type Character and cannot be successfully converted to Character.

Explanation.p: The getChar() and readChar() methods can read only Character values or values that can be converted to Character.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: A call to getBytes() or readBytes() on a Message object failed because the value is not of type byte array (byte[]) and cannot be successfully converted to a byte array.

Explanation.p: The getBytes() and readBytes() methods can read only byte arrays (byte[]) or values that can be converted to byte array.

OperatorResponse.p: Attempt to get or read the content as type Object.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to read Message object content because the message is not readable.

Explanation.p: Content can be read from a message only when the message object is readable.

OperatorResponse.p: The reset() and initContent() methods make a message readable.

Message.MsgText: A method call to retrieve text data from a message failed because the UTF-8 text encoding is not valid.

Explanation.p: This error can occur when calling readUTF() on a BytesMessage, getText() on a TextMessage, or getString() on a property in an object cast to ImaProperties. In the case of readUTF(), the error can occur when attempting to read non-text data as text. Otherwise, the error indicates that the UTF-8 encoding for the content is not valid.

OperatorResponse.p: In the case of readUTF(), ensure that the content is text data. Also, ensure that the content is encoded at the time the message body or property value is set. If encoding is done correctly, ensure that the producer and consumer have not altered the original content. Otherwise, network issues might explain the data corruption.

Message.MsgText: An attempt to read content from a BytesMessage failed because the end of the message was reached. Attempted to read {0} bytes but {1} bytes were left.

Explanation.p: An exception occurs when attempting to read past the end the message content for a BytesMessage.

OperatorResponse.p: None if there are zero bytes left in the message. If one or more bytes remain, try reading the remaining bytes to see if there is an issue with the way the data was read or with the data itself.

Message.MsgText: A failure occurred when reading data received from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the end of the data was reached unexpectedly. This indicates that data corruption occurred.

Explanation.p: The apparently truncated data content indicates data corruption occurred.

OperatorResponse.p: When this occurs when reading JMS message content, check the message content originally provided by the producer. Corruption can occur in transmission from the producer to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT}, or in transmission from ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} to the consumer. When it occurs in other cases, check the stack trace for information about the request that failed.

Message.MsgText: A call to getObject() on an ObjectMessage failed due to an exception during deserialization.

Explanation.p: An unexpected error occurred during deserialization in a call to getObject() on an ObjectMessage.

OperatorResponse.p: Check the caused by information in the stack trace for this exception.

Message.MsgText: The ObjectMessage.getObject() method is disabled due to a security risk.

Explanation.p: The ObjectMessage.getObject() method is disabled due to a security risk when receiving an ObjectMessage from an untrusted source.

OperatorResponse.p: The use of ObjectMessage where the data is not known to be from a trusted source is a security exposure that can lead to denial of service and system takeover. If you must use ObjectMessage and you know that the source of the message data is trusted, you can enable ObjectMessage by setting the Java system property IMAEnforceObjectMessageSecurity to false in the configuration of the Java runtime environment.

Message.MsgText: A call to readBytes() on a StreamMessage failed because the byte array argument is null.

Explanation.p: The readBytes() requires a non-null byte array argument.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the byte array used to hold the data is properly instantiated before calling readBytes().

Message.MsgText: A call to get data from a MapMessage failed because the map element {0} does not exist in the message or the element contains a null object.

Explanation.p: A MapMessage map element can be retrieved only if the element exists in the MapMessage and the element content is non-null.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that the map element exists and contains a non-null object before calling methods on it.

Message.MsgText: A call to onMessage() failed due to an unhandled exception.

Explanation.p: The onMessage() method implemented in the JMS application failed due to an unhandled exception.

OperatorResponse.p: Examine the stack trace from the exception and make any necessary updates to the onMessage() method.

Message.MsgText: A read operation on a StreamMessage object failed because there were bytes remaining to be read after a previous call to readBytes().

Explanation.p: Read methods on a StreamMessage object that are invoked after a previous call to readBytes() can succeed only after readBytes() finished reading data. This is indicated when readBytes() returns -1.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that readBytes() returns -1 before attempting to read subsequent data from a StreamMessage.

Message.MsgText: A call to getChar() on a MapMessage or to readChar() on a StreamMessage failed because the map element {0} contains a null object or the stream object is null.

Explanation.p: The getChar() MapMessage method can read only Character elements that contain a non-null object. The readChar() StreamMessage method can read only non-null Character objects.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that map Character elements contain a non-null object before calling getChar(), and that stream elements are not null when calling readChar().

Message.MsgText: A method call to create a MapMessage element failed because the name specified is null or is an empty string.

Explanation.p: A MapMessage element can be created only for non-null element names with a length of at least one.

OperatorResponse.p: Ensure that names for MapMessage elements are strings with a length of at least one.

Message.MsgText: A call to {0} failed because the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} JMS client does not support this method.

Explanation.p: An optional JMS method that is not supported by the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_FULL} JMS client was called.

OperatorResponse.p: Use only supported methods.

Message.MsgText: A call to start() on a Connection object failed with ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} return code: {0}.

Explanation.p: A request to start a JMS connection failed because ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} reported an error.

OperatorResponse.p: Contact the ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} administrator and provide the return code reported.

Message.MsgText: A call to the stop() method on a Connection object failed because it was called from onMessage().

Explanation.p: You cannot call the stop() method from the onMessage() method.

OperatorResponse.p: Call the stop() method only from outside the onMessage() method.

Message.MsgText: The client failed to establish a secure connection to ${IMA_PRODUCTNAME_SHORT} because the security socket factory class {0} does not implement the javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory interface.
